title: Baked potatoes with pickle & herb tuna mayo

ingredients.item: Olive oil, to rub and drizzle
2 x 150g cans tuna in olive oil, drained
10 cornichons and 8 onions, drained and finely chopped (from a jar of pickled cornichon and onions)
1 lemon, finely grated zest and squeeze of juice
25g pack basil, leaves only, finely chopped
20g pack dill, leaves only, finely chopped
½ x 330g pack fresh beetroot, cubed

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 200ºC, gas mark 6. Wash and dry the potatoes, then rub with oil and a little sea salt. Put on a baking tray and roast for about 1 hour 15 minutes-1 hour 30 minutes until the skin is golden and crisp and they give when lightly squeezed.
Meanwhile, put the tuna in a bowl and mix with the yogurt, mayonnaise, cornichons and onions, mustard, lemon zest and juice, basil and most of the dill. Season.

Split the potatoes and spread each one with a little butter, then fill generously with the tuna mixture. Serve with the salad leaves and beetroot, drizzled with a little olive oil, seasoning, and a scattering of the remaining dill.
